dt: {bc}two successive lines of verse forming a unit marked usually by rhythmic correspondence, rhyme, or the inclusion of a self-contained utterance {bc}{sx|distich||}

dt.t: She ended her poem with a rhyming {wi}couplet{/wi}.

et: Middle French, diminutive of Old French {it}cuple, couple{/it} {dx_ety}see {dxt|couple:1||}{/dx_ety}
shortdef: two successive lines of verse forming a unit marked usually by rhythmic correspondence, rhyme, or the inclusion of a self-contained utterance : distich

dt: {bc}a rhymed couplet in which the sense is complete

shortdef: a rhymed couplet in which the sense is complete
a rhyming couplet in iambic pentameter
